TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Point

Docs.summary: Represents a single point in a series in a chart.

remarks.para: The Point object is a member of the collection. The Points collection contains all the points in one series.

Use Points(), where is the point index number, to return a single Point object. Points are numbered from left to right on the series. Points(1) is the leftmost point, and Points(Points.Count) is the rightmost point.

MemberSignature.Value: public object _ApplyDataLabels (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlDataLabelsType Type = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlDataLabelsType.xlDataLabelsShowValue, object LegendKey, object AutoText, object HasLeaderLines);

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the Microsoft Excel application.

MemberSignature.Value: public object ApplyDataLabels (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlDataLabelsType Type = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlDataLabelsType.xlDataLabelsShowValue, object LegendKey, object AutoText, object HasLeaderLines, object ShowSeriesName, object ShowCategoryName, object ShowValue, object ShowPercentage, object ShowBubbleSize, object Separator);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object ApplyDataLabels([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlDataLabelsType Type, [in]object LegendKey, [in]object AutoText, [in]object HasLeaderLines, [in]object ShowSeriesName, [in]object ShowCategoryName, [in]object ShowValue, [in]object ShowPercentage, [in]object ShowBubbleSize, [in]object Separator) runtime managed

Public Function ApplyDataLabels (Optional Type As XlDataLabelsType = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlDataLabelsType.xlDataLabelsShowValue, Optional LegendKey As Object, Optional AutoText As Object, Optional HasLeaderLines As Object, Optional ShowSeriesName As Object, Optional ShowCategoryName As Object, Optional ShowValue As Object, Optional ShowPercentage As Object, Optional ShowBubbleSize As Object, Optional Separator As Object) As Object

Docs.param: Optional . The type of data label to apply. Can be one of the following XlDataLabelsType constants:xlDataLabelsShowBubbleSizesxlDataLabelsShowLabelAndPercent Percentage of the total and category for the point. Available only for pie charts and doughnut charts.xlDataLabelsShowPercent Percentage of the total. Available only for pie charts and doughnut charts.xlDataLabelsShowLabel Category for the point.xlDataLabelsShowNone No data labels.xlDataLabelsShowValue Default. Value for the point (assumed if this argument isn't specified).
Optional Object. True to show the legend key next to the point. The default value is False.
Optional Object. True if the object automatically generates appropriate text based on content.
Optional Object. For the and objects, True if the series has leader lines.
Optional Object. The series name for the data label.
Optional Object. The category name for the data label.
Optional Object. The value for the data label.
Optional Object. The percentage for the data label.
Optional Object. The bubble size for the data label.
Optional Object. The separator for the data label.
Docs.summary: Applies data labels to a point in a chart.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ApplyPictToEnd { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if a picture is applied to the end of the point or all points in the series.

remarks.para: This property only applies to 3-D charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ApplyPictToFront { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if a picture is applied to the front of the point or all points in the series.

remarks.para: This property only applies to 3-D charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ApplyPictToSides { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if a picture is applied to the sides of the point or all points in the series.

remarks.para: This property only applies to 3D charts.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Border As Border
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Border ^ Border { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::Border ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the border of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object ClearFormats() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Clears the formatting of the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Copy() runtime managed

Docs.summary: If the point or series has a picture fill, copies the picture to the Clipboard.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As XlCreator

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which this object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns the string XCEL, which is equivalent to the hexadecimal number 5843454C.
The Creator property is designed to be used in Microsoft Excel for the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Excel has the creator code XCEL.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DataLabel As DataLabel

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the data label associated with the point or trendline.

remarks.para: To turn on data labels for a trendline you need to set the property or the property to True.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Delete() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Deletes the object.

remarks.para: Deleting a object deletes the entire series.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Explosion { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the explosion value for a pie-chart or doughnut-chart slice. Returns 0 (zero) if there's no explosion (the tip of the slice is in the center of the pie).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Fill As ChartFillFormat

Docs.summary: Returns a object for a specified shape or a object for a specified chart that contains fill formatting properties for the shape or chart.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Format As ChartFormat

Docs.summary: Returns the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Has3DEffect { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns and Sets a value that states if a point has a three-dimensional appearance. Read/Write.

remarks.para: Returns True if a point has a three-dimensional appearance.
This property applies to bubble charts only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool HasDataLabel { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the point has a data label.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Height As Double
public: property double Height { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the height, in points, of the object.
Docs.value: The height, in points, of the object.

remarks.para: Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Interior As Interior

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the interior of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool InvertIfNegative { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Excel inverts the pattern in the item when it corresponds to a negative number.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Left As Double
public: property double Left { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that represents the distance, in points, from the left edge of the object to the left edge of the chart area.
Docs.value: The distance, in points, from the left edge of the object to the left edge of the chart area.

remarks.para: Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MarkerBackgroundColor { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Sets the marker background color as an RGB value or returns the corresponding color index value. Applies only to line, scatter, and radar charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlColorIndex MarkerBackgroundColorIndex { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlColorIndex get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlColorIndex value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the marker background color as an index into the current color palette, or as one of the following constants: xlColorIndexAutomatic or xlColorIndexNone. Applies only to line, scatter, and radar charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MarkerForegroundColor { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Sets the marker background color as an RGB value or returns the corresponding color index value. Applies only to line, scatter, and radar charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlColorIndex MarkerForegroundColorIndex { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlColorIndex get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlColorIndex value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the marker foreground color as an index into the current color palette, or as one of the following constants: xlColorIndexAutomatic or xlColorIndexNone. Applies only to line, scatter, and radar charts.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MarkerSize { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the data marker size in points.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlMarkerStyle MarkerStyle { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlMarkerStyle get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlMarkerStyle value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the marker style for a point or series in a line chart, scatter chart, or radar chart.

remarks.para: can be one of the following XlMarkerStyle constants:
xlMarkerStyleAutomatic. Automatic markers
xlMarkerStyleCircle. Circular markers
xlMarkerStyleDash. Long bar markers
xlMarkerStyleDiamond. Diamond-shaped markers
xlMarkerStyleDot. Short bar markers
xlMarkerStyleNone. No markers
xlMarkerStylePicture. Picture markers
xlMarkerStylePlus. Square markers with a plus sign
xlMarkerStyleSquare. Square markers
xlMarkerStyleStar. Square markers with an asterisk
xlMarkerStyleTriangle. Triangular markers
xlMarkerStyleX. Square markers with an X

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Name As String
public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the object name.

remarks.para: Read-only.
This property corresponds to the name of a data point on a chart. The name is represented using the following format: S<series number>P<point number>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the parent object for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Paste() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Pastes a picture from the Clipboard as the marker on the selected point.

remarks.para: The Paste method can be used on column, bar, line, or radar charts, and it sets the property to xlMarkerStylePicture.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlChartPictureType PictureType { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlChartPictureType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Excel::XlChartPictureType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the way pictures are displayed on a column or bar picture chart.

remarks.para: can be one of the following XlChartPictureType constants:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int PictureUnit { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the unit for each picture on the chart if the property is set to xlStackScale (if not, this property is ignored).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property double PictureUnit2 { double get(); void set(double value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the unit for each picture on the chart if the property is set to xlStackScale (if not, this property is ignored). Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance float64 PieSliceLocation([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPieSliceLocation loc, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPieSliceIndex Index) runtime managed
Public Function PieSliceLocation (loc As XlPieSliceLocation, Optional Index As XlPieSliceIndex = Microsoft.Office.Interop.Excel.XlPieSliceIndex.xlOuterCenterPoint) As Double

Docs.param: Specifies a horizontal or vertical coordinate.
Specifies which pie slice position coordinate to return. The default value is .
Docs.summary: Returns the vertical or horizontal position of a point on a chart item, in points, from the top or left edge of the object to the top or left edge of the chart area.
Docs.returns: The vertical or horizontal position of a point on a chart item, in points, from the top or left edge of the object to the top or left edge of the chart area.

remarks.para: This property only applies to pie and doughnut chart types.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SecondaryPlot { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the point is in the secondary section of either a pie of pie chart or a bar of pie chart. Applies only to points on pie of pie charts or bar of pie charts.

Docs.summary: Selects the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Shadow { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if the font is a shadow font or if the object has a shadow.

Docs.value: The distance, in points, from the top edge of the object to the top edge of the chart area.
